meanings.definition: A follower or member of the religious group founded by Aleister Crowley.
meanings.sent1: The willemites gathered at the temple for their evening prayers.
meanings.sent2: Many willemites attend the weekly ceremonies at the church.
meanings.sent3: The willemites decided to have a picnic in the park after their service.
meanings.sent4: She stood out in the crowd like a willemites in a sea of regular churchgoers.
meanings.sent5: The willemites' dedication to their beliefs was unwavering.

meanings.definition: Plural form of 'willemitic', relating to the teachings or beliefs of Aleister Crowley.
meanings.sent1: The room was decorated with willemites symbols and artwork.
meanings.sent2: The willemites teachings influenced many aspects of their daily lives.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly referred to his friend as a willemites enthusiast.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a willemites maze of mystical thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with a willemites sense of mystery and wonder.
